abstract: The French drug maker said it was seeking the consent of the American company’s shareholders to replace directors with a slate of its own candidates.
snippet: The French drug maker said it was seeking the consent of the American company’s shareholders to replace directors with a slate of its own candidates.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The French pharmaceutical company Sanofi said on Wednesday that it would seek to replace the board of Medivation after the American drug maker’s directors rejected a $9.3 billion takeover offer.

headline.main: Sanofi to Seek Removal of Medivation Board in Takeover Fight
